intro: Crossandra cinnabarina, commonly known as the red flame plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically green with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Crossandra cinnabarina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
